title.rendered: University of Winnipeg English language Requirements 2024

content.rendered:
The University of Winnipeg English Language requirements, Appropriate criteria, International national curriculum pathways

The University of Winnipeg English language Requirements for admission for International candidates who wish to apply for admission.

 

English Language Requirement – Test and Program Options

Test Name: Duolingo
Full Name: Duolingo English Test
Requirement: The least amount score of 115. Received on a trial basis for Spring & Fall intake.

Test Name: TOEFL
Full Name: Test of English as a Foreign Language
Internet-based – Achieve the least amount score of 86 with no less than 20 in each part.
Script-delivered Test results will be reviewed on a character basis.

Test Name: IELTS
Full Name: International English Language Testing System
IELTS Academic – least amount overall group score of 6.5
IELTS Indicator – least amount generally group score of 7.0. Received while in-country IELTS testing is suspended.

Test Name: Cambridge Assessment English: C1 Advanced
Full Name: Cambridge Assessment English: C1 Advanced
Requirement/Score: Minimum score of 180

Test Name: Cambridge Assessment English: C2 aptitude
Full Name: Cambridge Assessment English: C2 aptitude
Requirement/Score: Minimum score of 180

Test Name: Contest
Requirement: A standard score of 4.5 in Listening and Reading; and a score of 4.0 in script
a score of 3.5 in Writing may be considered, depending on the program of study, and provided the student is registered in Academic Writing Extended (ESL).

Test Name: CAEL, CAEL-CE, CAEL online
Full Name: Canadian Academic English Language Assessment
Requirement/Score: CAEL and CAEL-CE – Minimum score of 60; CAEL online – Minimum score of 70

Test Name: PTE
Full Name: Pearson Test of English (Academic)
Requirement: least amount of score of 58

Test Name: AEPUCE
Full Name: Academic English Program for University and College Entrance
Requirement: Successful Completion

Program Name: ELP
Full Name: English Language Program at The University of Winnipeg
Requirement: Successful Completion of Academic Level of 5.3

Program Name: English Language Program
Full Name: Part-time sunset Program at The University of Winnipeg
Requirement: Minimum C+ in intellectual Writing Part 1 and 2

 

Tuition fees: a student attending university in Ontario always paid a standard of $8,838 in schooling, while a student in Manitoba paid $4,501. (This was intuition 2024 Statistics in Canada)

Appropriate criteria

  •  Successful completion of High School
  • Successful  accomplishments of Grade 12 English
  • Student must have at least amount  of 65% average that includes English and any other course necessities programmed below
  • Successful accomplishments of the university admission requirements of your country of origin

The International national curriculum pathways

International Baccalaureate : An IB diploma with 3 HL courses and 3 SL courses.  For transfer credit or advanced standing, no grade below 4 accepted.
The least amount points essential: 24
The minimum total score of 24 points

For more information intladmissions@uwinnipeg.ca
